title: Brazil : poverty headcount ratio at 3.20 U.S. dollars a day 2005 to 2017
summary: The headcount rate in the Brazil has been decreasing in the past few years .

In 2017 , approximately 9.6 percentage of the Dominicans were living on less than U.S. dollars day per 2005 , almost three-times lower than 2005 , when 19.7 percentage of the country 's population was estimated to live in headcount .
gold: In 2017 , the poverty headcount ratio at 3.20 U.S. dollars a day in Brazil amounted to 9.6 percent , which means that almost 10 percent of the Brazilian population was living on less than 3.20 U.S. dollars per day.
The poverty rate has increased since 2014 , when the headcount ratio was below seven percent .
